about_the_game:
Search an incredibly detailed hand-drawn environment for spanners. When you find one, click it to mark it as yours. The game is won once everything has been found, and a scoreboard will be displayed showing who found what. No time limit, just you and your friends. Singleplayer is available too!

Full level preview

The colours can be customised ingame to be less harsh on the eyes.

Difficulty: Medium

Ways to play together:

🖱️ Mouse (Default)
⌨️ Keyboard (WASD, TFGH, IJKL, or arrow keys)
🎮 Gamepads (Click here for detailed gamepad info)
▶️ Steam remote play
📶 LAN (Over the same wifi)
🌐 Online (Experimental, connectionless, no port forwarding needed)
And any combination of the above! Or play by yourself in singleplayer too!

What’s in the box?

🌄 1 hand drawn panoramic level
🔎 100+ hidden objects to find
💬 Ingame chat
💡 Unlimited hints
🏆 Paced achievements
🎨 Different colour theme options for tired eyes
🎵 Relaxing music (can be disabled)

Scoring modes:

- Incremental score: Each object is worth 1 point
- Multiplier scoring: Objects progressively get more valuable towards the end of the game

Online multiplayer

This game uses an experimental form of P2P, so both host and player must enter each other’s IP addresses to connect (these settings are remembered between games). This means that you won't need to port forward, and also means that the game isn't reliant on a matchmaking server. But it also might not work at all in some circumstances. It will work best on home modems, but may not work on large wifi networks with extenders. In this case, you'll either have to port forward, use a VLAN service, or use steam remote play.

Seamless binging experience

Settings and recently connected players will be remembered across all the games in the series, so you won't need to keep entering IP addresses unless they've changed. In just a few clicks, you can all be reconnected in the next game.

Streamer friendly

Once you've set it up, IP addresses will never be shown in-game by the UI.

Coop or versus?

It’s up to you! Each player selects a colour, and then what they found glows that colour. But you could just use the same colour for everyone. When playing online, all your local players become one team/colour anyway.

Controls

Search the image by clicking and dragging with the mouse. Click objects to mark them as found. Alternatively you can use any set of arrow keys (e.g. WASD + E to 'click') or gamepads.

A balance of achievements

Achievements are granted for the important milestones of the level, such as the first object, half way through, and the last few.

Credits:

Scene drawn by @septian3alfandi (instagram)
